title.narrative: Central America Mezzanine Infrastructure Fund II

description.narrative: Reduce Infrastructure Bottlenecks: Fund will provide capital for infrastructure projects which will contribute to the competitiveness of the target region and will help eliminate critical infrastructure bottlenecks that limit growth and job creation. Economic and Private Sector Development: Fund will provide quasi-equity and equity capital to help promote growth and job creation in local communities. Demonstration Effects: Fund will strengthen investees from a financial and governance perspective and help them scale up their operations, thus making them more attractive targets for further investment. This will help to demonstrate the business case for private infrastructure projects and encourage more private investors to enter the sector in the target region.

The Central American Mezzanine Infrastructure Fund II LP (CAMIF II or the Fund) is a follow-on fund to the existing CAMIF fund (Fund I), in which IFC is currently an investor. Like Fund I, CAMIF II is a 12 year mezzanine Fund that will invest in operating and new (brownfield and greenfield) medium-sized companies/projects in infrastructure and related sectors in Central America, the Caribbean, Mexico and Colombia. The Fund will make subordinated long-term US dollar loans, with current coupon and equity participation features as well as straight equity investments. The Fund will be managed by a subsidiary of LAP Latin American Partners LLC (LAP). A first closing of US$80-150M is expected in November 2013 and a second closing reaching the target amount of $250M is expected up to one year later.
